summary: This is an email chain from August 11, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff discussing how to respond to a U.S. Senate letter regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case, specifically Question 4. The correspondence shows internal deliberation on drafting a conservative response in line with guidance from the Office of Legislative Affairs (OLA).

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is the primary recipient and initiator of the email chain, requesting a draft response to a Senate letter's Question 4 regarding the Epstein case and providing guidance on the drafting approach.

events.title: Internal SDNY Email Discussion on Senate Letter Response
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other SDNY staff exchange emails to coordinate drafting a response to Question 4 of a letter from U.S. Senator Ben Sasse to Attorney General William Barr concerning Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain dated August 11, 2019, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
The discussion centers on drafting a response to Question 4 of a letter from U.S. Senator Ben Sasse to Attorney General William Barr regarding Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.
The correspondence references guidance from the Office of Legislative Affairs (OLA) to either not respond or to respond by repeating the question and public record information.
The email chain indicates a request for a draft response to be prepared on the same day (August 11, 2019).
The attachment referenced is a PDF file named '08-10-2019---sasse-letter-to-ag-barr-re-epstein-suicide.pdf', indicating the Senate letter was dated August 10, 2019.
